title: Primer (textbook)
text:
A primer (in this <a href="word%20sense">sense</a> usually pronounced , sometimes ) is a first <a href="textbook">textbook</a> for teaching of <a href="Reading%20%28process%29">reading</a>, such as an <a href="alphabet%20book">alphabet book</a> or <a href="basal%20reader">basal reader</a>. The word also is used more broadly to refer to any book that presents the most basic elements of any subject.
The <a href="Latin%20language">Latin</a> "Enschedé <a href="Abecedarium">Abecedarium</a>" of the late 15th century, translated into <a href="English%20language">English</a> as the "Salisbury Prymer", has been identified as the earliest example of a <a href="printing">print</a>ed primer. It presented the <a href="alphabet">alphabet</a> and several <a href="Catholic">Catholic</a> <a href="prayer">prayer</a>s.
Other historical examples of primers for children include:
